User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Inventário Fácil application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created.

lastLogin.description: Timestamp indicating the last time the user logged in.

googleId.description: Unique identifier from Google OAuth, if the user registered with Google.

definition.description: Stores user profile data. The document ID is the user's unique Firebase Auth ID.  This structure is chosen for path-based ownership.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user, obtained from Firebase Authentication.

definition.description: Stores inventory data for a specific user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user who owns the inventory.

params.name: inventoryId
params.description: The unique ID of the inventory.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication, user profiles, and inventory data management. It prioritizes authorization independence by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules. User data is stored in `/users/{userId}`. This structure allows for easy management of user profiles and simplifies security rules based on user ID.
